learning_objective: Compare and refine multiple algorithms for the same task and determine which is the most appropriate.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on a program for their social studies project that will take different socio-economic indicators and calculate the Gini coefficient, a measure of income inequality. They have found two different ways of coding this, methodA() and methodB(). They decide to choose the method which computes more quickly. How could Alex determine which method executes more quickly?",
    "Answer1": "Alex could use a system timer to measure how long each method takes to execute",
    "Answer2": "Alex could use a loop to increment a counter each time a method is called and choose the method with the highest count",
    "Answer3": "Alex could run both methods and choose the one that outputs the correct Gini coefficient",
    "Answer4": "Alex could ask their friends which one they think will execute faster",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "A system timer would be the best way to accurately measure the execution time of each method. The other options would not provide a reliable measure of how quick each method is, since they rely on manual counting or unsophisticated guesses.",
    "code_snippet": "action methodA(items[] item)
    integer n = item.length
    decimal sum = 0
    for integer i = 0 to n
        for integer j = 0 to i
            sum = sum + absolute(item[i].income - item[j].income)
        end
    end
    decimal gini = sum/(2*n^2*mean(item))
    return gini
end"
}
